[Packages](/docs/apis/) &gt; [@fluid-tools/api-markdown-documenter](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter) &gt; [DocumentationSuiteOptions](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter/documentationsuiteoptions-interface)

Options for configuring the documentation suite generated by the API Item -\> Documentation Domain transformation.

## Signature {#documentationsuiteoptions-signature}

```typescript
export interface DocumentationSuiteOptions
```

## Property Details

### documentBoundaries {#documentboundaries-propertysignature}

See [DocumentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#documentboundaries-typealias).

#### Signature {#documentboundaries-signature}

```typescript
documentBoundaries?: DocumentBoundaries;
```

### frontMatter {#frontmatter-propertysignature}

Optionally generates front-matter contents for an `ApiItem` serving as the root of a document (see [DocumentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#documentboundaries-typealias)). Any generated contents will be included at the top of a generated document.

#### Signature {#frontmatter-signature}

```typescript
frontMatter?: string | ((documentItem: ApiItem) => string | undefined);
```

#### Remarks {#frontmatter-remarks}

Note: this is arbitrary text, and will not be escaped.

### getFileNameForItem {#getfilenameforitem-propertysignature}

Generate a file name for the provided `ApiItem`.

#### Signature {#getfilenameforitem-signature}

```typescript
getFileNameForItem?: (apiItem: ApiItem) => string;
```

#### Remarks {#getfilenameforitem-remarks}

Note that this is not the complete file name, but the "leaf" component of the final file name. Additional prefixes and suffixes will be appended to ensure file name collisions do not occur.

This also does not contain the file extension.

#### Example {#getfilenameforitem-example}

We are given a class API item "Bar" in package "Foo", and this returns "foo".

The final file name in this case might be something like "foo-bar-class".

### getHeadingTextForItem {#getheadingtextforitem-propertysignature}

Generate heading text for the provided `ApiItem`.

#### Signature {#getheadingtextforitem-signature}

```typescript
getHeadingTextForItem?: (apiItem: ApiItem) => string;
```

### getLinkTextForItem {#getlinktextforitem-propertysignature}

Generate link text for the provided `ApiItem`.

#### Signature {#getlinktextforitem-signature}

```typescript
getLinkTextForItem?: (apiItem: ApiItem) => string;
```

### getUriBaseOverrideForItem {#geturibaseoverrideforitem-propertysignature}

Optionally provide an override for the URI base used in links generated for the provided `ApiItem`.

#### Signature {#geturibaseoverrideforitem-signature}

```typescript
getUriBaseOverrideForItem?: (apiItem: ApiItem) => string | undefined;
```

#### Remarks {#geturibaseoverrideforitem-remarks}

This can be used to match on particular item kinds, package names, etc., and adjust the links generated in the documentation accordingly.

### hierarchyBoundaries {#hierarchyboundaries-propertysignature}

See [HierarchyBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#hierarchyboundaries-typealias).

#### Signature {#hierarchyboundaries-signature}

```typescript
hierarchyBoundaries?: HierarchyBoundaries;
```

### includeBreadcrumb {#includebreadcrumb-propertysignature}

Whether or not to include a navigation breadcrumb at the top of rendered documents.

#### Signature {#includebreadcrumb-signature}

```typescript
includeBreadcrumb?: boolean;
```

#### Remarks {#includebreadcrumb-remarks}

Note: `Model` items will never have a breadcrumb rendered, even if this is specfied.

### includeTopLevelDocumentHeading {#includetopleveldocumentheading-propertysignature}

Whether or not to include a top-level heading in rendered documents.

#### Signature {#includetopleveldocumentheading-signature}

```typescript
includeTopLevelDocumentHeading?: boolean;
```

#### Remarks {#includetopleveldocumentheading-remarks}

If you will be rendering the document contents into some other document content that will inject its own root heading, this can be used to omit that heading from what is rendered by this system.

### skipPackage {#skippackage-propertysignature}

Whether or not the provided `ApiPackage` should be skipped during documentation generation.

#### Signature {#skippackage-signature}

```typescript
skipPackage?: (apiPackage: ApiPackage) => boolean;
```
